fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller user 
*I want to* see the % numbers rounded up or down 
*So that* there are not decimal numbers in the ops reports app

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I am able to see % in the following sections:
- Statistics: General Section
- Statistics: Delays by %

*Then* those % will be rounded up or down

 !decimals 1.png|thumbnail! 
 !decimals 2.png|thumbnail! 

2. *Given* % are rounded up or down
*Then* decimals </= .4 (included) will be rounded down
(i.e. 3.4 should be rounded to 3)
*And* decimals >/= .5(included) will be rounded up
(i.e. 3.5 should be rounded to 4)

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller user 
*I want* the fields 'From' and 'To' from the positioning sectors section to be editable in a record that comes from Netline 
*So that* I can always modify these values

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

*Context*
Current behavior only allows user to edit 'From' and 'To' fields when the record has been manually added.

1. *Given* I am in the positioning sectors section
*And* a new record is added from Netline
*When* I enter the edit mode
*Then* the fields 'From' and 'To' will be editable
*And* I will be able to modify these fields
*And* I will be able to save changes

h2. *3. Note*

FIelds 'From' and 'to' continue to be editable when record has been manually added by user (current behavior)

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* edit the fields 'from', 'to', and 'delay by arrival' from the delays>3hrs section
*So that* I can modify these values

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I am in the 'Delays>3hrs' section
*And* I enter the edit mode
*Then* I will be able to edit the following fields from an existing record
- From
- To
- Delay by arrival
 !editable fields.png|thumbnail! 

*And* I will be able to save the changes done

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want* reason 'Crew Incapacity' to be removed from reason field dropdown list AND replace it by  'Crew Absence' 
*So that* I can choose this reason from the dropdown list

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I click on 'reason' field in any of the following sections:

- Diversions
- Cancellations
- Crew Delays
- Positioning sectors
- Operational issues
- Delays > 3hrs (Arrival)

*And* the dropdown list is displayed
*Then* the reason 'Crew Incapacity' will not be in the list 
*And* it will be replaced by reason 'Crew Absence'

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* see the correct value for 'Flts > 1HR' (both Number and %)
*So that* I am aware of this information

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

*Context* 

- Now we show the field DELAY_60_MINS of the netline report and it has to be (FLIGHTS - DELAY_60_MINS)
- Now we show the field %_delay_60_mins of the netline report and it has to be (100% - %_delay_60_mins)

{color:#d04437}1. *Given* I am in the General section of the Statistics screen
*Then* I will be able to see the correct values for Flts Delayed > 1Hr (number & %)
*And* value for Number will be calculated as: FLIGHTS - DELAY_60_MINS
i.e. 1984 - 1959 = 25
*And* value for % will be calculated as: 100% - %_delay_60_mins
i.e. 100- 98.74 = 1.26{color}

h2. *3. Note*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

*UPDATE*
1. We should ONLY consider flights with STA <= now
2. Number = Number of flights with *STA - real time of arrival > 60mins*
3. % = % of Number of flights with *STA - real time of arrival > 60mins - total flights with STA <= now*

*And* value for Number will be calculated as: FLIGHTS - DELAY_60_MINS
i.e. 1984 - 1959 = 25
*And* value for % will be calculated as: 100% - %_delay_60_mins
i.e. 100- 98.74 = 1.26{color}

h2. *3. Note*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

*UPDATE*
1. We should ONLY consider flights with STA <= now
2. Number = Number of flights with *STA - real time of arrival > 60mins*
3. % = % of Number of flights with *STA - real time of arrival > 60mins* - total flights with STA <= now

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* Edit AND Delete a row previously added to the "Positioning Sectors" section
*So that* I can modify the values or delete all the information

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I add a new row to the "Positioning Sectors"section
*Then* I will see in the column 'Actions' the Edit option
*And* I will see in the column 'Actions' the Delete option
*And* I will be able to click on them

2. *Given* I click on 'Edit'
*Then* I will enter the edition mode
*And* all fields from the row will become editable

3. *Given* I click on 'Delete' 
*Then* a 'delete row' popup will be displayed
*And* I will be able to click on 'Delete' to confirm the action
*Or* click on 'Cancel' to cancel the action

h2. *3. Note*

+Edit Action+
 - If the record has been added by Netline, the user must be able to modify all fields which are NOT coming from Netline (manually introduced by user)
 - If the record has been added by the user, the user must be able to modify all the fields and the mandatory fields can not be blank
*In this particular case, whether info comes from Netline or is manually added, all fields should be editable except Flight Number: see OPREP-595*

+Delete Action+
- If a record has been added by the user, the user must be able to delete the record at any time
- If a record has been added by Netline, the user won't be able to delete the record

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As an* ops reports user
*I want* all the 'Flight Number' fields to allow a max of 7 characters
*So that* 'service type' flights are allowed in the app 

*Context*

Currently the app allows for 6 characters flights. 
There is a potential case where a 7 digit number would be introduced, when it is a 'service type' flight 'P'. 
In this case, the flight number should be FLIGHTNUMBERP (i.e. FR6375P)
 !Capture.PNG|thumbnail! 

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* the ops reports app needs to allow for service type flights
*Then* the app will allow for a max of 7 characters flight numbers 
*And* both letters and numbers will be allowed (varchar)

- OPS & CREW
- WEATHER

*Actual Result*

 

The Edit button is not shown

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* have a new row 'Scheduled maintenance line' under Aircraft details section
*So that* I am able to add/see this information

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

*Given* I am in the Aircraft details section (Statistics)
*Then* I will be able to see a new row called 'Scheduled maintenance line' 
*And* I will be able to manually add/edit the fields on it 

h2. *3. Note*

- The field can not be calculated automatically and it has to be updated by the user manually.


 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
*Configuration*
Environment: SIT
Browser: Chrome
*Description*
In Cancellations, the fields "From" and "To" are blocked to edit when the record is added by the user in OPS, and they must be editable.

The fields that came from Netline are:
 * Flt No.
 * From
 * To

*Rules*
 * If the record has been added by Netline, the user must be able to modify all fields which are NOT coming from Netline (manually introduced by user)
 * If the record has been added using OPS Report, the user must be able to modify all fields (Except Flt No)
 * If a record has been added by Netline, the user won't be able to delete the record
 * If a record has been added using OPS Report, the user can delete the record

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Add a Cancellation from OPS and Save it
 # Click on edit
 # Validate the editable fields

{color:#14892c}*Expected Result*{color}
The fields From and To are editable
{color:#d04437}*Actual Result*{color}
The fields From and To are blocked

!image-2020-01-31-15-08-46-413.png|width=897,height=345!

fields.description:
*Configuration*
 * Environment: SIT
 * Browser: Chrome

*Description*

The app shows an error 400 when you Edit a Netline Diversions record.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Create a Diversion in Netline
 # Go to OPS 
 # Edit the Diversion created filling all the enabled fields (Reason, Description, Status, CS Comment)
 # Save the changes

*Expected Result*

The new record is saved correctly

*Actual Result*

The app doesn't save the record (you see in form but if refresh they disappear) and shows this error 400:

{"message":"Diversion with id: com.ryanair.ops.reports.model.whathappen.DiversionId@8a9c309c wasn't created by user and can't be updated"}

!image-2020-01-23-10-38-34-052.png|width=1186,height=568!
fields.summary: Error 400 when you Edit a Netline Diversions record.

items.fromString:
*Configuration*
 * Environment: SIT
 * Browser: Chrome

*Description*

The app shows an error 400 when you add Diversions with Status filled. Also happens when you edit and fill the Status field.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Click on Add Diversions
 # Fill all the mandatory fields and the Status field.
 # Click on save

*Expected Result*

The new record is saved

*Actual Result*

The app doesn't save the record and shows this error:

{"message":"JSON parse error: Cannot construct instance of `com.ryanair.ops.reports.model.Status` (although at least one Creator exists): no int/Int-argument constructor/factory method to deserialize from Number value (2); nested exception is com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.MismatchedInputException: Cannot construct instance of `com.ryanair.ops.reports.model.Status` (although at least one Creator exists): no int/Int-argument constructor/factory method to deserialize from Number value (2)\n at [Source: (PushbackInputStream); line: 1, column: 114] (through reference chain: com.ryanair.ops.reports.model.whathappen.Diversion[\"status\"])"}

!image-2020-01-21-12-29-58-962.png|width=1044,height=448!
[BE] Error 400 when you Edit a Netline Diversions record.

fields.description:
*Configuration*
 * Environment: SIT
 * Browser: Chrome

*Description*

The only Diversions mandatory fields are Flt. No., From, To and Divert to, it works fine when you create one but when you edit you get an error 400 because Reason and Description are considered as mandatory.

Error: \{"message":"Reason id is required and must correspond with an existing Reason, Description is required and its length has to be less than 1000 characters"}

polyfills-es2015.e946d402b7706e693155.js:1 PUT https://web-ocr-api-sit.fr152.ryanair.com/v1/whatHappen/diversions/when/2020-01-22/flightNumber/TT6666 400

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Add a Diversion only with this fields: Flt. No., From, To and Divert to
 # Save 
 # Click on Edit that record
 # Change one of the mandatory fields
 # Save

*Expected Result*

You save a Diversion without Reason and Description

*Actual Result*

Error 400 because Reason and Description are empty 

 

!image-2020-01-22-13-39-53-554.png|width=1299,height=588!
fields.summary: [BE] The Reason and Description fields mustn't be mandatory field when you edit.

fields.description:
*Configuration*
 * Environment: SIT
 * Browser: Chrome

*Description*

Following the Judit comment in the story OPREP-370, the Tax field must show the paxs that already finished the trip, but currently we are showing the total pax load.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # In Netline open the flights for today
 # Open a flight without Actual Time of Departure (ATD) set.
 # Go to page 3 
 # Click Edit
 # Add 1 pax in the fields highlighted in the image
!image-2020-01-21-16-28-32-338.png|width=461,height=576!
 # Save changes
 # Publish changes and wait 4 min 
 # Check OPS: Statistics - General - Pax
 # The PAX number doesn't increase
 # Return to Netline and add to the flight the ATD time and the Landing time
 # Save changes
 # Publish changes and wait 4 min 
 # Check OPS: Statistics - General - Pax
 # The PAX number increase in 1

*Expected Result*

The TAX field shows the paxs that already finished the trip.

*Actual Result*

 

The TAX field shows all the paxs, even if the plane hasn't arrived or even taken off.

fields.description:
*Configuration*
 * Environment: SIT
 * Browser: Chrome

*Description*

If you edit a record and then you discard the changes, when you edit it again, the app is showing the discarded data, not the actual data in the fields".

This is happening in the following sections:
 * Daily report
 ** General
 ** Controller Comments
 ** Diversions
 ** Cancellations
 ** Operational Issues
 ** Ryanair SunDelays > 3hrs (Arrival)
 ** Learjet
 * Statistics
 ** General
 ** Aircraft Details
 ** CI100 PDL
 ** All other CI100
 ** CVR Issues
 ** Delays by %

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Create a record in any of the sections mentioned above
 # Click on the Edit of that record
 # Change all the fields values
 # Discard the changes
 # Click on Edit again

*Expected Result*

The values shown in the Edition mode are the actual data.

*Actual Result*

 

The values shown in the Edition mode are the discarded data.

Note: If you wait a long time the discarded data is no longer shown. !image-2020-01-15-11-30-48-087.png!

!image-2020-01-15-11-32-09-378.png!
fields.summary: [FE] The data discarded is still showing when you edit a record

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a*  user
*I want to* be able to select any past day in the calendar without time restriction AND add/remove/edit existing records 
*So that* I can see all information from that past day

*Context*

-Current behavior: crew control can only select a day from one month back in the past (i.e. If user access 15 January 2020, user can select any day from past until 16 December 2019)
-Current behavior: crew control can only add/remove/edit records from 4 days back in the past following OPREP-374 

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I access Ops reports web app
*And* I click on the calendar
*Then* I will be able to select any day from the past without time restriction

2. *Given* I select any day from the past without time restriction
*Then* I will be presented with all the information from that day

3. *Given* I want to add an existing record from any past day
*Or* remove an existing record from any past day
*Or* edit an existing record from any past day
*Then* I will be able to do so without time restriction (except the CS fields following OPREP-528)

*Then* I will NOT be able to do so 

h2. *3. Note*

*Crew Control user Rights* - Read AND Edit all fields from 'Statistics' and 'Daily Report' sections except of CS Comment & Status fields.
*Customer Service user rights* - Read only all fields from  'Statistics' and 'Daily Report' and Edit CS Comment & Status fields.

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I access Ops reports web app
*And* I click on the calendar

2. *Given* I select any day from the past without time restriction
*Then* I will be presented with all the information from that day
*And* only CS fields (cs comment + status) will be enabled
*And* I will be able to edit them 

3. *Given* I want to add an existing record from any past day
*Or* remove an existing record from any past day
*Or* edit an existing record from any past day apart from the CS comment and the status
*Then* I will NOT be able to do so 

h2. *3. Note*

fields.description:
*Actual Result*

When a user discards changes when updates a row, some fields are not refreshed to the old values.

If website is refreshed or is forced with the button 'refresh', all fields are refreshed (OK).

 

It happens in several subsections, for example in 'Cancellations' subsection, "Description" and "CS Comment" are not restored to previous value.

See attached screenshot.

 

*Actual Result*

When discarding changes, all values should display the old values.

 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Login in OPS website.
 # Go to 'Cancellations' subsection.
 # Add a row and save changes.
 # Edit all values of the row, and DISCARD changes.
 # Not all values are restored to the previous value.

 

!Discard Changes - KO.png|width=1071,height=1197!

*Configuration*

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* Edit AND Delete a row previously added to the Diversions section
*So that* I can modify the values or delete all the information

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I add a new row to the Diversions section
*Then* I will see in the column 'Actions' the Edit option
*And* I will see in the column 'Actions' the Delete option
 !delete edit options.PNG|thumbnail! 
*And* I will be able to click on them

2. *Given* I click on 'Edit'
*Then* I will enter the edition mode
*And* all fields from the row will become editable

3. *Given* I click on 'Delete' 
*Then* a 'delete row' popup will be displayed
*And* I will be able to click on 'Delete' to confirm the action
*Or* click on 'Cancel' to cancel the action

h2. *3. Note*

- Delete: Only records which are NOT coming from Netline
- Edit: All fields which are NOT coming from Netline (manually introduced by user)
- Edit: Editable fields which come from Netline

items.fromString: This issue is cloned by OPREP-449

h2. *1. Narrative*

fields.description:
*Configuration*
 * Environment: SIT
 * Browser: Chrome

*Description*

The field "No. Spares at start of daily ops" is not shown in the table when you login. It must be shown even when it doesn't come with a value because the user is allowed to edit it.

*Workaround*: When you go to Daily report and back the row is shown.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Login to OPS
 # Statistics section is shown by default
 # Open the General sub section

{color:#14892c}*Expected Result*{color}

The field "No. Spares at start of daily ops" is shown

{color:#d04437}*Actual Result*{color}

The field "No. Spares at start of daily ops" is not shown

!image-2019-11-18-11-30-35-742.png|width=811,height=576!

fields.description:
h3. *1. Narrative*

*As an* ops controller
*I want to* have a new subsection 'A/C out of Base' under section General in the Daily report screen 
*So that* I am able to edit this records

h3. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I am in the General section of the daily report screen
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
*Then* I will be able to see a subsection 'A/C out of a base' 
*And* this subsection will be positioned the last 
*And* it will be editable (same as other subsections)

2. *Given* the subsection is editable
*Then* user will be able to modify the field for 4 days OPREP-374

h3. *3. Note*

Note for QA: Given the User has accessed the main screen of the Daily OPS Report- What happened today Section- subsection General
then the user should be able to edit Day Controller, Night Controller,Weather Issues for today, ATC issues,Other and A\C out of base
- Information does not come from Netline

items.fromString: Confirm with the business if we need the A/C out of base field

Hi [~santosm],
Please, can you create a new story....
1) under Daily report - general, the last records should be A/C out of Base 
2) field editable (the same type of field than others)
3) user should be able to modify the field for 4 days

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

ThKS!

-------------





1. Narrative and purpose of this user story
 As OPS Controller/OPS Manager when I open the application

I want to be presented with a General sub-section as part of the Daily OPS report What happened today section subsection General

In order to be able to edit records

2. Acceptance Criteria
 

1. Given the User has accessed the main screen of the Daily OPS Report- What happened today Section- subsection General
then the user should be able to edit the records after 'A\C out of base' 

 

Note for QA: Given the User has accessed the main screen of the Daily OPS Report- What happened today Section- subsection General
then the user should be able to edit Day Controller, Night Controller,Weather Issues for today, ATC issues,Other and A\C out of base

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* have Add and Edit and Preview reason unavailable popups in the Learjet section
*So that* I can manually add or edit or see a reason unavailable

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

h3. *{color:#14892c}Add reason unavailable popup{color}*

1. *Given* the field 'Reason unavailable' does not have a comment added
*And* I enter the edit mode
*When* I click on the description field
*Then* an 'add reason unavailable' popup will be displayed

 !add reason popup.PNG|thumbnail! 

2. *Given* the 'add reason unavailable' popup is displayed
*Then* I will be able to write a comment on it
*And* I will be able to 'save' it
*Or* to 'cancel' the action

3. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on save
*Then* the comment edited will be saved

4. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on discard
*Then* the comment edited will NOT be saved


h3. *{color:#14892c}Edit reason unavailable popup{color}*

5. *Given* the field 'Reason unavailable' has a comment previously added
*And* I enter the edit mode
*When* I click on the comment previously added
*Then* an 'edit reason unavailable' popup will be displayed

6. *Given* the 'edit reason unavailable' popup is displayed
*Then* I will be able to edit the comment written
*And* I will be able to 'save' the changes
*Or* to cancel the action

 !edit reason popup.PNG|thumbnail! 

7. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on save
*Then* the comment edited will be saved

8. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on discard
*Then* the comment edited will NOT be saved

h3. *{color:#14892c}Preview reason unavailable popup{color}*

6. *Given* a comment has been added
*And* I want to read the whole comment
*Then* I will be able to click on the comment
*And* a preview reason unavailable popup will be displayed
*And* I will be able to see the whole comment wirtten
*And* I will be able to close the popup

 !reason unavailable popup.PNG|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* have Add and Edit and Preview CS comment popups 
*So that* I can manually add or edit or see a CS comment 

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

*Context*
CS comment is new column added to:
- Delays>3 hrs section
- Diversions section
- Cancellations section

So this US is for those 3 sections

h3. *{color:#14892c}Add comment popup{color}*

1. *Given* the field 'CS comment' does not have a comment added
*And* I enter the edit mode
*When* I click on the CS comment field
*Then* an 'add comment' popup will be displayed
 !add comment popup.PNG|thumbnail! 

2. *Given* the 'add comment' popup is displayed
*Then* I will be able to write a comment on it
*And* I will be able to 'save' it
*Or* to 'cancel' the action

3. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on save
*Then* the comment edited will be saved

4. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on discard
*Then* the comment edited will NOT be saved

 !discard save changes.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. *{color:#14892c}Edit comment popup{color}*

5. *Given* the field 'CS comment' has a comment previously added
*And* I enter the edit mode
*When* I click on the comment previously added
*Then* an 'edit comment' popup will be displayed
(same as the 'edit description' popup, just the word 'comment' instead of 'description')
 !edit description popup.PNG|thumbnail! 

6. *Given* the 'edit comment' popup is displayed
*Then* I will be able to edit the comment written
*And* I will be able to 'save' the changes
*Or* to cancel the action

7. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on save
*Then* the comment edited will be saved

8. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on discard
*Then* the comment edited will NOT be saved

 !discard save changes.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. *{color:#14892c}Preview comment popup{color}*

5. *Given* a comment has been added
*And* I want to read the whole comment
*Then* I will be able to click on the comment
*And* a preview decription popup will be displayed
*And* I will be able to see the whole comment wirtten
*And* I will be able to close the popup

(same as the 'edit description' popup, just the word 'comment' instead of 'description')
 !popup comment.PNG|thumbnail!

*And* I enter the edit mode (click on Edit Action - image attached from designs)

*When* I click on the description field
*Then* an 'add description' popup will be displayed
 !add description popup.PNG|thumbnail! 

2. *Given* the 'add decription' popup is displayed
*Then* I will be able to write a comment on it
*And* I will be able to 'save' it
*Or* to 'cancel' the action

3. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on save
*Then* the comment edited will be saved

4. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on discard
*Then* the comment edited will NOT be saved

 !discard save changes.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. *{color:#14892c}Edit description popup{color}*

*And* I will be able to 'save' the changes
*Or* to cancel the action

7. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup

*And* I click on save
*Then* the comment edited will be saved

8. *Given* I click on 'save' in the popup
*And* I go back to the edit mode
*And* I click on discard
*Then* the comment edited will NOT be saved

h3. *{color:#14892c}Preview description popup{color}*

*And* a preview decription popup will be displayed
*And* I will be able to see the whole comment wirtten
*And* I will be able to close the popup

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*

*As a* crew controller
*I want to* see two new columns (Status AND CS comment) in Diversions section
*So that* I can introduce this information

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

1. *Given* I am in the 'Daily Report' screen
*And* I go to the 'Diversions' section
*Then* I will be able to see two new columns:
- Settle/defend
AND
- Customer Service comment

*And* the two columns will be editable 

2. *Given* the Status column is editable
*Then* I will be able to see a drop-down list 
*and* I will be able to select only one of three options: 
'- or blank' OR 
'Settle' OR 
'Defend' 

*Same as for 'delays > 3 hrs' section* :
  !Status column.png|thumbnail!  

3. *Given* the customer service comment column is editable
*Then* I will be able to write a comment on it OPREP-421

4. *Given* the customer service comment column is editable
*Then* I will be able to edit the comment added previously OPREP-421

5. *Given* a comment has been added to the CS comment column
*And* I want to read the whole comment 
*Then* I will be able to click on the comment
*And* a pop-up will be displayed OPREP-421

7.*Given* the record is introduced automatically by Netline
*Then* the fields CS comment and "Settle/Defend" will be blank/dash by default


h2. *3.Notes*
1. "Settle/Defend" field: preferably a drop-down list
2. CS comment field has to have the same length than the current Description field
3. Editable 4 days in the past

fields.description:
h2. *1. Narrative*
*As a* crew controller
*I want to* see the correct values for 'Flts within 15 mins' AND 'Flts Delayed > 1Hr' fields
*So that* I am aware of this information

h2. *2. Acceptance Criteria*

*Context* 
- These values, both  'number' and '%', are calculated in netline report https://netlreports/cgi-bin/sql/login.pl , but the Ops Reports web is displaying the wrong values.

1. *Given* I am in the Daily statistics screen 
*And* I go to the General section (see image attached)
*Then* I will be able to see the correct values for 'Flts within 15 mins' (number & %)
*And* those values will be those calculated using netline report
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
Flights within 15 min has to be the value of the delay_15_min field of the image below
% flights within 15 min has to be the value of the %_delay_15_min field of the image below
!screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 



2. *Given* I am in the Daily statistics screen 
*And* I go to the General section (see image attached)
*Then* I will be able to see the correct values for 'Flts Delayed > 1Hr' (number & %)
*And* those values will be those calculated using netline report
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Flights Delayed > 1 Hr has to be the value of the delay_60_mins field of the image below
% Flights Delayed > 1 Hr has to be the value of the %_delay_60_mins field of the image below
!screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 

h2. *3. Notes*
*Calculations:*
In order to see the correct values, you can access to  https://netlreports/cgi-bin/sql/login.pl
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 
Execute
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 

*Note:*
BI team can provide you the calculation of the report

SQL Attached
 [^fltsumm_arr-htmlv1.sql]
